intro: Ornithogalum nutans subsp. boucheanum, commonly known as the nodding cowslip, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of bell-shaped, white to pale yellow flowers that hang downward. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. This subspecies is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
